Nile's ProjectLIFE SAVING AWARENESS AND ACTION
WWW.NILESPROJECT.COM protecting patients.

December 6, 2022

Centers for Medicare & Medicaid ServicesDepartment of Health and Human ServicesAttention: CMS-0058-NCComments on a National Directory of Healthcare Providers & Services

Nile’s Project MRSA fully supports the development of a National Directory of Healthcare Providers & Services (NDH) as it could be an essential and valuable tool to assist health care consumers attempting to navigate our very complex and fragmented health care system. We approach this issue as patient-centered advocates working to end medical harm through transparency and accountability. Our comments therefore focus on the public accessibility and usability of information in an NDH

Nile’s Project MRSA is a public health patient safety awareness organization 501c3 established in 2007 to end preventable harm and death in our nations healthcare system after our son Nile Calvin Moss died at the age of 15 after contracting MRSA from unclean surfaces on an MRI at the top Children’s hospital in Orange County California. Days later Nile displayed flu like symptoms, multiple physicians did not take his signs of sepsis seriously and Nile died on April 17th 2006 after waiting in the hospital for 15 hours before he received a single drop of a life saving antibiotic. We work with The Patient Safety Action Network is a national coalition of individuals and organizations, consisting of patients who have been medically harmed, their loved ones, and concerned advocates. With a unified voice we focus solely on and with patients to raise awareness and to create accountability, transparency and safer health care. We work in the areas of physician oversight and accountability, medical device safety, health care acquired infection prevention and other topics. Additional information can be found here: https://www.patientsafetyaction.org/

Thank you for the opportunity to comment on this process.

Submitted by Ty and Carole Moss Founders of Nile’s Project mrsa
Please direct any questions to Carole Moss at Carolemoss@nilesproject.com , Tymoss95@gmail.com

Nile's Project is a Patient Safety Public Health Awareness 501c3 focused on ending preventable death and harm in healthcare and in Communities. Nile's Project's Address is 17325 High Country Circle Perris Ca 92570
